item.title: Strange syntax issues
item.dc:creator: @surfer247 surfer247
item.description:
@surfer247 wrote:

[quote=“White Castle, post:5, topic:9914”]public class GetNums { public int num1, num2, num3;//indenting my friend public String stringnum1, stringnum2, stringnum3; public static void main(String args[]) { stringnum1 = JOptionPane.showInputDialog("What is the first number?"); stringnum2 = JOptionPane.showInputDialog("What is the second number?"); stringnum3 = JOptionPane.showInputDialog("What is the third number?"); num1 = Integer.parseInt(stringnum1); num2 = Integer.parseInt(stringnum2); num3 = Integer.parseInt(stringnum3); System.out.println("Da frst # wuz " + num1);//you really didn't have to parseint it unless you wanted to do some other stuff with it. System.out.println("Da scnd # wuz " + num2); System.out.println("Da thrd # wuz " + num3); } }[/quote]

Did you try running that because I don’t think it will work. The class variables need to be static for it to access them (it might still run, but I doubt it). Just add a static after the public in the variables to get it to work if it doesn’t.

Read full topic

public class GetNums { public int num1, num2, num3;//indenting my friend public String stringnum1, stringnum2, stringnum3; public static void main(String args[]) { stringnum1 = JOptionPane.showInputDialog("What is the first number?"); stringnum2 = JOptionPane.showInputDialog("What is the second number?"); stringnum3 = JOptionPane.showInputDialog("What is the third number?"); num1 = Integer.parseInt(stringnum1); num2 = Integer.parseInt(stringnum2); num3 = Integer.parseInt(stringnum3); System.out.println("Da frst # wuz " + num1);//you really didn't have to parseint it unless you wanted to do some other stuff with it. System.out.println("Da scnd # wuz " + num2); System.out.println("Da thrd # wuz " + num3); } }
